result.execSummary:
The defendant Gregory P. Edelson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Clark County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Sentence is imposed and stayed, if imposed defendant is granted huber priveleges and 60 days to pay any outstanding financial obligations as ordered by the Court.

The defendant shall pay Department of Correction fees as directed by the agent.  Defendant was ordered to report upon release from jail if agent has not made prior contact to the probation and parole office.
Concurrent with: Probation in 15CM237 & 15CM131 to run concurrent to each other

miscConds.notes: $57.00 of bond posted in 15CM131 applied, remaining fine and/or costs to be paid on a schedule established by the agent.   Defendant is ordered to pay the DNA surcharge, and to make arrangements to provide a DNA sample, within 48 hours, for testing through the Clark County Sheriff Department or if on probation, to the Department of Corrections as is required in all criminal convictions.

Defendant shall attend counseling, treatments, programming, evaluations as deemed appropriate by the agent releasing all records to the agent upon request. 
Additionally defendant is to have a Psychological evaluation and share the results with the agent.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol, and not go into places that sell alcohol except incidentally such as a grocery store, convenience store or gas station or other such place where alcohol is not sold for consumption on the premises. Exception to entering the above establishments  only as it may be required in the scope of employment and then only with permission of the agent.  

Defendant shall not possess or consume any medication or drug except as may be specifically prescribed by a medical professional for defendant, and then shall be taken only as prescribed.  

The defendant shall submit to random urine/PBT testing as required by the agent or any law enforcement officer.  
The defendant shall have no contact with Desiree Garcia  of any kind, whether direct or indirect, including in person, in writing, by phone, by e-mail or other electronic means, through a third party or in any other way.  

The defendant shall have no contact with Delilah Edelson of any kind, whether direct or indirect, including in person, in writing, by phone, by e-mail or other electronic means, through a third party or in any other way without Ms Edelson's permission as well as the agreement of the agent.

timeConds.notes: Defendant granted huber privileges and credit for 32 days served.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
